definition: Mechanical motion and processes that occur within internal combustion engines during operation

positive_examples: The engine cranked to life on the cold morning
During the compression stroke, the piston moved upward
Exhaust gases were expelled from the cylinder
The intake valve opened to draw in the fuel mixture
The combustion cycle pushed the piston downward with force
The two-stroke engine completed its transfer phase
negative_examples: The car accelerated down the highway
The wheels rotated as the vehicle moved forward
The transmission shifted into higher gear
The brake pedal was pressed to stop the car
The steering wheel turned left at the intersection
The suspension absorbed the road bumps
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: VehicleMotion, RotationalMotion, LinearMotion, FluidMotion, OscillatoryMotion

opposite_reasoning: EngineMotion lacks a clear direct antonym since it's a specialized mechanical process. BiologicalProcess provides the strongest available opposition: mechanical/artificial vs organic/natural processes. Both are dynamic processes (maintaining same ontological level) but represent fundamentally different domains - engineered mechanical systems vs evolved biological systems. This contrast is semantically meaningful for Fisher-LDA while having strong availability in both WordNet and SUMO. It provides better steering utility than pure category oppositions (process vs object) while being more concrete than abstract mental processes.
